name: chicagotribune
text: RT @chitribopinions: National political conventions long ago lost the vital purpose they used to serve. But do you recall how a little-known state senator from Illinois gained a national profile overnight? The moments of meaningful action still matter, Steve Chapman writes. https://t.co/zhHNCaotr0

name: chicagotribune
text: The U.S. Postal Service says it lost $2.2 billion in the three months that ended in June as the beleaguered agency ‚Äî hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic ‚Äî piles up financial losses that officials warn could top $20 billion over two years. https://t.co/6VGdDAb2NL

name: chicagotribune
text: Postmaster General Louis DeJoy is shuffling dozens of officials on his executive leadership team as the U.S. Postal Service announces it lost $2.2 billion in the three months that ended in June https://t.co/o02N4JCYOy

text: President Donald Trump said Friday night he was likely to issue more limited executive orders related to COVID-19, perhaps in the next day or so, if he can‚Äôt reach a broad agreement with Congress https://t.co/c61OxPwTqJ
